Clara HD porting thread matrix test

[matrix] Szybet Ok, @vesto here you can ask things, write your loud thoughts and all
[matrix] Szybet actually not, the discord bot gets confused
have you thought about porting InkBox to the Hisense A5?
would that even be possible/reasonably easy?
Probably not
Easiest ports are those whereyou have a way to recover from bricks+ serial access afsik
So removable storage
Or a Flashing tool that works with corrupted main storage
Yes, but even then, Hisense has an Android platform afaik
Which makes it kind of harder to port inkbox kernel over
yeah, its android with a lot of built in chinese apps, and you have to install aurora/fdroid to get apps unless you happen to read chinese (i can't)
If you're lucky someone will port pmOS to the a5
If you're lucky twice or pay szybet for it you could run inkbox on pmOS
PostmarketOS
https://postmarketos.org/

embeds.title: postmarketOS // real Linux distribution for phones
embeds.description: Aiming for a 10 year life-cycle for smartphones

messages.content: Well, unless you want to run inkbox in a VM, porting it to pmOS is probably a no-go as already discussed
Dont want /=/no go
Well, \*probably\* I said

But just from the infrastructure standpoint, it's not doable
You would lose like 80% of the features
Inkbox relies on old packages, and uses a chroot to run on newer devices with newer kernel/OS right?
Uses chroots for everything
Containerizes everything
@dandelion  would still suggest pmOS and then figuring out a way to port a reader if you're set on the a5. Their project has more people, but very few who do eink optimized ui as good as inkbox
Then on a pmos install that would probably work too
it looks like pmOS is working on the Hisense A9, that's cool
Not with chroots
Would need proot or some other things
It wouldn't let it use UID 0
mostly it was a "just wondering" question. sounds like it's difficult/not really possible, and would strain the resources of a small team, so i'm not wondering anymore
Probably better to get it on a supported reader
Like nia
I think andi also had some suggested tweaks that would make running inkbox on devices with different kernel seemless, have you had time to look at that?
Not *that* seamless

I looked at it, these are good ideas I don't have time to implement
But it probably wouldn't help as for pmOS
Inkbox lives in its sandbox, it's programmed to think it has the whole room for itself
If you spend some time you can probably figure out how to compile koreader or plato for pmOS
Including root
Yes, that will probably work better right away
Koreader already ships Linux appimages
For x86
So: get pmOS on highsense a9, then compile koreader for it I guess
@dandelion
Should get you close to what you want I think?
Maybe just get it on your nia if you like it more
Also there is a koreader Android app
yeah, i think the starting place is once my nia arrives, figure out how to open it without breaking it, or see if my friend will help, etcher an sd card, and go from there
Btw, there is a pmOS port for the nia, if you want to play around with that
It's missing an efficient ui like inkbox though
Nia has too little ram for xfce to be usable
It works, but you dont really have much left for programs
Maybe you can try openbox and tint2?
https://pkgs.alpinelinux.org/package/edge/community/x86/tint2
Could work maybe?
i have no programming skills, experience.   i'm at a very basic level, and a slow learner with tech things.  i can usually figure out intermediate level user stuff
pmOS is really close to a normal Linux distro
It's quite good
That and matchbox keyboard

https://youtu.be/qOQt6Fxew2s?si=cNe4tukTk-OEfB1I
See here

Poor eink
that's pretty cool.  it's fun to play videos on my Hisense A7CC.

just trying to move out of that ecosystem.  Yeah, it's android.  if I cover the camera when it's locked, and try to unlock it, i get a message, "Do not cover the top of the screen" with a rectangle with the top 3rd shaded
it gives you the option to press the power and volume up button to turn that off, but i think i'd have to do that every time i open my phone if i put a sticker on the camera
also trying to get ahead of the issues discussed here: https://odysee.com/@RobBraxmanTech:6/e2e-x:0

Hi,
I'm a full stack developer (but with no experience in C++). Recently, I bought a Kobo Clara 2E and would love to support with testing / porting. I commented in this GitHub issue: https://github.com/Kobo-InkBox/inkbox/issues/50

So, first step would be to open the Kobo and flash the current image on the SD card?

embeds.title: Kobo Clara 2E  Issue #50  Kobo-InkBox/inkbox
embeds.description: Hi, does Inkbox run on Kobo Clara 2E EInk reader?

messages.content:
Hi
let me create a thread first, what is your device model number? should be written somewhere
The model is N506.
Started a thread.

Hey saw this issue: https://github.com/Kobo-InkBox/inkbox/issues/4

I got rudimentary code experience and can handle flashing a sd card. Im lost on making a serial connection. Will I need to solder something or can it be done through USB?

embeds.title: Kobo Clara HD  Issue #4  Kobo-InkBox/inkbox
embeds.description: Hi, does Inkbox run on Kobo Clara HD EInk reader?

messages.content: Id love to help either by testing or contributing code if appropriate.
well, there is a kobo clara port
things changed a bit
Yea I was reading comments that said kernels updated for that image. But wasnt seeing it in the latest release, so I thought more work was needed?
well, it boots
towards full ui
Ah, I see where I can do a build for it. Ill give it a go and poke around, thanks.

well, the full reason for all that is: I do not want to change sd cards, so I examine possibilities to multi-boot, so I have inkbox, debian and postmarketos on one card, and to avoid mess with changing partition numbers, I tried to use gpt
which causes some mess on inkbox side
inkbox uses maybe mounting partytion by bytes offset
blame nicolas
if you do not have such strange things.. it should be simplier.
I hopefully try again this evening
to recreate a plain inkbox sdcard
Happy to help on the clara hd effort as well, just got my device / am wiring up serial now.
look #deleted-channel
Started a thread.
test
Out of curiosity, why exactly do you need the official kernels from Kobo?

Afaik every linux kernel should contain information about how it was built in /proc/config.gz, so unless they made massive changes I don't see why you couldn't use that file to build a vanilla kernel with a generic eink driver.
Because both NXP and kobo do some changes that are horrible hacks most of the time
And those are weird and device specific
For older models its worse, for newer its getting better
If we get a mainline kernel running on a kobo clara 2e or a device that runs it, other devices could also run mainline
Mainline in itself has problems
Kobo clara hd still doesnt work
@andi : Which model does `kobo,aura2` map to in your kernel? (Remember, Kobo's naming scheme is terrible, there are eleven billion devices with "aura" in the name). The Aura Second Edition?
The other contender on an imx6sl would be the Aura H2O (which is often shortened to "H2O" to avoid the Aura mess)
Okay, yeah, checked the dts, E60QL is the Aura SE
PCB picture of mine if you need more info

* Device tree for the Kobo Aura 2 ebook reader
 *
 * Name on mainboard is: 37NB-E60QL0+4B1
I always write down those things
especially since the clara revision mess
There's also Aura 2 v2, which doesn't work with v1 SD images
the PCB inscription on those is 37NB-E60QL0+4C0
so these refresh issues?
and other revisions?
well, the clara2e is next in my porting queue
yep
the more devices run somehow mainline the easier we can debug things
and fix probably issues on several devices
clara2e will be interesting because if refresh problems are not there, then it is probably something with the epd pmic
so we can narrow things down
That PMIC is TPS65186?
probably
yes, that one is for the display
clara2e has a sy7636
I tried it for a project some years ago, it was very problematic
there is something near mainline for the clara2e too
i don't remember if mine was 65185 or 65186
clara hd vendor vs. mainline, there are bugs fixed in mainline and later also fixed in the vendor kernel, and there are bugs in the near-mainline kernel but not in the vendor kernel.
Yeah, curious how the Clara 2E's PMIC would fare on mainline, because it's.... fairly fucked up on vendor.
Yeah, that one was a doozy. Same PCB ID, *completely* different SoC.
They did the same with the H2O 2
Well, I enabled the regulator stuff and no smoke yet... cpufreq seems to work and adjusts regulators
but again there is A and B. Difference is the epd pmic, and the one in b was afaik never forward ported to anything near mainline. And I have b 😦
for a there is some older mainline port although it is a bit messed up regarding the regulators
I think cpufreq is not working properly on any kobo kernel with the rohm pmic
Greetings everyone. Is this the place to ask if Inkbox might possibly work with Kobo Aura H2O?
yes but you would need to port it you need time, linux knowledge is welcome documentation are the threads in #porting you are welcome
and hello btw

Thanks man. I'll have to look into it. I'm actually not sure what to do with my unit. I got it as a gift, but it had been cleaned with a damp cloth.. damp. It's supposed to be water proof. Because half of width and half of height doesn't work, I do wonder if it is some sort of firmware glitch with the version I've been trying to install - which I have to look up.

idk, inkbox won't resolve hardware issues but im sure you could use it at least to some extend without the part of the screen
That's what I'm hoping
idk maybe even a photo frame, second screen, news agregator or anything
a small server
whatever really
its a pure linux device then
just a underpowered one
maybe, idk im not that active on discord
It will work as an e-reader, just so long as I can select books, get to settings and flip pages with the bottom half of screen.
koreader will do the trick i think
it has some bad ui but i think its pretty resilient to such things
ping me in the porting thread if i dont respond normally, discord threads sometimes dont show up

school and things

Im talking about me
ok
a new toy
for dumping voltages of the bd71879
found in the nia c
clara2e
some libra2
so run it on every device
which uses that regulator to understand whether there is something unexpected done in kernel
you need to specify the bus number the pmic is on
You could detect it automatically i think?
But thats very cool anyway
such toys if done properly could enavle us gathering info on devices that arw not yet supported via Quillwrite
well, i was just too lazy to do that

```root@bookworm:~# BUSNUM=`echo /sys/bus/i2c/devices/?-004b | sed 's|.*/\(.\).*|\1|'`
root@bookworm:~# echo $BUSNUM
2
root@bookworm:~#```
huh, awesome
so instead of booting uboot just run this?
run this on any device with bd71879 in it
when it is running normally
to find out how the regulators are really set up
to put that into any devicetree or verify that the vendor kernel sources match at least what is actually running in case of regulator configuration
uboot hacks would be to detect board versions to load the correct devicetree (+ hwconfig binaries if kobo vendor kernel is run)
